name: Welcome Piram Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We have been to Rome many times and this is the first hotel which we feel we can recommend to others. The cost is very reasonable and excellent value for money. The hotel was a little hard to find - locate it on a good map first before you start walking and there is no obvious sign just an entrance into a lovely reception area. The location, very close to Terminni and the bus station is perfect. There are also some reasonable and bars close by.
reviews.title: Great value a little gem - it's almost tempting not to tell you!

likes.liked: — The location and great value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I heard that staying near the train station in Rome is kind of sketchy, however my husband and I were pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The room was average and had a smallish flat screen on the wall, lots of storage space and the bathroom was of average size with a bidet. We also had a balcony, which was nice. The bed was VERY comfortable, kind of like a tempurpedic. I would have liked to have 2 pillows each, but we also didn't ask for them. The TV is also a clock that we used for the alarm on mornings we had to wake up early. They offer body wash/shampoo combo, but no conditioner.
reviews.title: Welcome Home, Roma Pass - beat my expectations Angel Tours - not great

likes.liked: — Location - also next door to a cheap internet cafe
likes.disliked: — Definitely more of a discount hotel, you get what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast wasn't fantastic, but it worked. The milk for my cereal was room temperature, and they offered several types of pasteries - some were really good! The service staff was very nice.
reviews.title: Be careful when you book this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As for the location, in my opinion, it couldn't be beat! It was a block away, and with the Roma Pass that offers unlimited public transport rides, it worked out great to get to the Coloseum, Spanish Steps, Trivi Fountain, Vatican, etc. We would walk around at night and felt extremely safe. Roma Pass is fantastic - buy it at the airport as soon as you land in Rome and it covers your 30 min. train ride to the station along with public transport as I had mentioned and 2 free amusements ( we used it for the Coloseum - they have a separate line so we didn't wait a minute to get in, and the National Museum) if you were to visit other places included on the Roma Pass, I am told you also get discounts.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel for under $90 (USD)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Friday we went to the Vatican and did the Angel Tour so we were able to enter before the rest of the public. This would be great had we not waited for late tourists for the entire hour and entered as the public entered! On their website they say they'll wait for late comers, however, they do not say that they make the entire tour group wait along with them!! Big red flag in my opinion. The tour guides were very nice, and kept the group to 15 at most which was nice. They kept everything pretty light in a stuffy museum and if you're really interested in religious art, it may be worth it. It's a LONG tour - lasting 3 hours & if you're not an art enthusiast, I would definitely skip the Vatican Museum and go directly to the Basilica - which is free!!!
reviews.title: Loved the Welcome Residences !

likes.disliked: — Breakfast could be better, less sugary things, toastmaker and tea would be nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I arrived in Rome late last Thursday night having booked this hotel on recomendation from a family member who had stayed there previously.
reviews.title: Noisy but would stay again

likes.disliked: — Noisy when sleeping in the rooms by the road

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hi,
reviews.title: Good hotel , Good location except breakfast and wake up call!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel during my ROME trip in May,2007 end. I took Ryanair flight and reached ROME CIAMPINO Airport late night. I took Terravision bus which runs from airport to termini frequently. Its better to take return ticket which will cost around 14 Euros.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel, Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I reached Termini aaround mid night and the rome looks bit lousy at the time. NEVER EVER TRUST THE TAXI GUYS IN ROME. I asked some taxi guys about the location but they all tried to fool me by suggesting that its very far.
reviews.title: Perfect location for tourists

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: But when I asked few noble guys and referred to the map, its hardly 100 mtrs walk (3 minutes) from TERMINI. They don't have a big board but can be easily located on Via Giovanni 7 street.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Hotel only 5 mins from main Termini station so very convenient and easy to find when you arrive. Reception staff very welcoming and spent 10 mins giving info on Rome. Lift is ancient but quite quaint. Rooms were big and very clean. Main gripe though that chest of drawers and bedside cabinets had no hadles on so could not open!! Did not affect us as we just used wardrobe but might be annoying for some. Also bathroom the smallest I have ever seen although shower was good.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was a sugarfest - certainly not to our taste. Choice of sugary cereals, sugary croissants, pastries, bread (but no toaster) but only toppings honey, nutella or jam. Even coffee (out of machine) was very sugary.
reviews.title: Loved the place in spite of water problems

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Found Rome very expensive to eat out. Very long queues to get into vatican museums - good tip is to go into St Peters Sq and Basilica in the morning then go to museum in the afternoon by which time queues much reduced.
reviews.title: Great Welcome, Great Value, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall Welcome Residences good location and fair value for money.
reviews.title: Great value and location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is 15 min walk from the Colosseum and Forum and about an hours walk from St Peter's, take the metro if exhausted from sightseeing. It is 5 min from the main Termini station.
reviews.title: superb staff and excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in Welcome residences from the 23rd to 27th of May 07, When we arrived we were put into the building next to their main building (where the reception was located), the room was on the sixth floor and very small, it wasn’t quite finished, the extractor in the bathroom was missing, the card security system and air-conditioning were put in but it was not working, the room was so hot that we hardly slept on our first night. Next day we asked to be moved and were moved to the main building. This room was much better and although the air-conditioning was still not perfect, the room was a lot cooler, bigger and nicely decorated.
reviews.title: I guess it can be nice once they have fixed everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was interested to read the article by Snowflyer, England - Oct 2, 2006.
reviews.title: Location but warnings, thieves! Mark 2

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location close to Termini (bus from airport to Termini around 30min then 5 min to hotel providing you dont get lost)
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You need to walk through the railway station to the other side, turn right, then second on the left after 150 yards, turn right at next junction and hotel is just up on the left) Room excellent, only negative was no hot drink making facilities) Staff friendly and despite mix up over room it was resolved quickly. 15 min walk to Collesium/ Palletine hill. We walked on Sunday on route taking in Spanish Steps, Trevi Fountain, Ravona Piazza, Pantheon and then over the river to St Peters and the Vatican. Can all be done on foot. Recommend Ristorante Terra Di Siena in Piazza Pasquino near Piazze Ravona and the bars and restaraunts in Campo Di Fiori
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and me have felt in love with Rome. We have been to this lovely city a numbers of times and we have found that Rome in December is fantastic. The weather is in general good and it is not crowded.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have found it very good to be in the area of the main railway station Termini. There are a lot of hotels in this area and the prices are good. So in September we booked a trip for Rome from 3rd December until 7th December. We found this hotel on hotel.com and the price was not that bad. We found out later that the price went down via another web site. Well, you can’t win all the time.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, Great Location

likes.disliked: — We did not recieve a wake call when we asked for one

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived in Rome on a Monday and took a direct train to Termini. Very good! The price was 11 Euro maybe a little more than average, but the trip was good. A person contacted us at the airport and offered to drive us to the hotel for 40 Euro!! So watch up.
reviews.title: Overnight not long enough in Rome, DUH!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After reading some of the reviews on this site I was slightly worried
reviews.title: A great hotel!

likes.liked: — The lift with the glass doors
likes.disliked: — The front of it, no idea it was a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: about staying at this hotel. However there was nothing to worry about, it was a great hotel and we really enjoyed our stay here.
reviews.title: Spacious rooms with all you need

likes.liked: — Location and very clean and spacious for Europe
likes.disliked: — Air Conditioning Problems and street noise in the front rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms are clean, large and newly decorated with a/c and a mini bar. Even the bathroom was quite big too. The hotel has character and we loved the old glass lift.
reviews.title: Very central for sightseeing. Clean hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Breakfast was not so great, it consisted of sweet crossiants, cakes, tarts, cereal and bread you can't toast. There was no ham, cheese or fruit but you can get this from the supermarket nearby. The coffee is from a machine and isn't strong.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those on a less expensive city break this hotel is perfect. It is located literally 2 mins walk from Romes main Termini train station, which itself has the 'Leonardo Express' running directly to and from Fiumicino Airport (11 Euro single ticket, journey time 30 mins)
reviews.title: Perfect Location and a Great Wee Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Termini is also the main Metro stop in Rome, the only station where the A and B lines meet, and so is a perfect hub from which to enjoy this amazing city.
reviews.title: Smashing place - would stay again
Great Location
reviews.text: The hotel itself is situated on a busy little street just to the left of Termini. It is just off Via Cavour, a main street packed with bars and restaurants, and there is an internet cafe right next to the reception. The room we stayed in, which was in a block a few doors down the road from the main hotel building, was big enough for the two of us, and was very clean with bed linen and towels changed daily. It also has a free working safe and a television.

reviews.title: Fantastic hotel, brilliant location...
reviews.text: The bathroom was small but very clean and the shower worked well (hot water is NOT required during a Roman summer!)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: 2 tiny little issues though. Although we booked a room with a double bed we were given 2 singles pushed together, and while these were comfy enough they tended to slip apart leading to more than one jarring mid-sleep fall. The other issue concerns the breakfast. As others has said it is very 'cakey' It consisted of, in total - iced croissants, huge sugared donuts, 2 types of cereals, bread, a small selection of jams, yoghurts, tarts, juice and coffee. Although it filled us up it would have been nice to see some meats, cheeses and more rolls and bread available, but maybe thats just Rome?
reviews.title: Gem of a hotel
Nice Hotel, would stay in again
reviews.text: This was a nice hotel, breakfast included which is nice while traveling!! Really close to the train station which is great as well. You can walk almost anywhere in Rome but your close enought to where the buses stop so you can take them as well. The floors were cold but the room was quite large. If you only speak english they only offer MTV in English, otherwise I hope you bring a dvd player. Internet is only offered in the lobby which is a bit of a hassle, would be nice to have it in the room but they said they were working on it. The front desk staff was very nice and helpful!

reviews.title: go for it!
reviews.text: My wife and I have recently returned from our first visit to Rome, staying at Welcome Residences. It was everything we could have hoped for. What a pleasant surprise to stay in a hotel which had atmosphere and style, so unlike the sterile boxes one takes for granted.

reviews.title: Good Value For Money
reviews.text: The locale is ideal: very near the Terminus Station and within walking distance of all the major sights.

reviews.title: How good was our welcome
reviews.text: I am not exaggerating when I say this must be the cleanest hotel I've ever stayed at. Not only were the floors, bathroom, etc., spotless - but it seemed as if all the furnishings and curtains had been cleaned that very day.

reviews.title: Very Pleased with Welcome Home
reviews.text: The breakfast was fine if you had a sweet tooth, but a slice of plain buttered toast would have been nice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007
reviews.text: Just returned from Welcome Residences and can safely say that the hotel was the only dissapointment in the whole trip. This was our second visit there and whilst the last one was a delight this one was terrible. Standards have defiantely deteriorated. Especially given the fact that the room rate has almost doubled since last year. I placed a positive review of the hotel after our last visit and would definately rescind it.
reviews.title: 2nd Visit. Diefiantely the last one. Never again.

description: If your arrival is before 2:00 p.m. and the room is not ready you can leave your luggage in our deposit and you will find your luggage directly in your room! If your departure is after 11:00 a.m. you can leave your luggage in our deposit and we will keep until your departure. Free access to the roof garden (depending by weather conditions.)
